title: Auction of Souls
studio: Selig Studios for the American Committee for Armenian and Syrian Relief
production_companies: Selig Studios for the American Committee for Armenian and Syrian Relief
cast_members: Aurora Mardiganian|Irving Cummings|Anna Q. Nilsson|Henry Morgenthau|Howard Davies|Hector Dion|Frank Clarke|Myles McCarthy|Eugenie Besserer|Lillian West

source_work.title: Ravished Armenia: The Story of Aurora Mardiganian, the Christian Girl, Who Lived Through the Great Massacres
source_work.formatted_title: Ravished Armenia: The Story of Aurora Mardiganian, the Christian Girl, Who Lived Through the Great Massacres

media.title: Auction of Souls (1919) - Poster
media.caption: Theatrical poster for Auction of Souls (1919)

media.title: Auction of Souls (1919) - Lyric Theater, Minneapolis.jpg
media.caption: The American film Auction of Souls (1919) being shown at the Lyric Theater in Minneapolis, Minnesota, on page 318 of the July 5, 1919 Motion Picture News. Ushers were dressed in Armenian garb for the film.
media.attribution: Selig Studios for the American Committee for Armenian and Syrian Relief

media.title: Auction of Souls (1919) - Hill Theatre, Newark NJ.JPG
media.caption: The American film Auction of Souls (1919) playing at the Hill Theatre in Newark, New Jersey, on page 753 of the July 3, 1919 Motion Picture News.
media.attribution: Selig Studios for the American Committee for Armenian and Syrian Relief

media.title: Auction of Souls (1919) - Liberty Theater, St Paul, Minnesota.jpg
media.caption: The American film Auction of Souls (1919) aka Ravished Armenia playing at the Liberty theater in St. Paul, Minnesota. A camel is in the front of the theater. On page 60 of the August 23, 1919 Exhibitors Herald.
media.attribution: Selig Studios for the American Committee for Armenian and Syrian Relief

media.title: Auction of Souls (1919) - Ad 2.jpg
media.caption: Ad for the American film Auction of Souls (1919) at the Garden Theater in Des Moines, Iowa, on page 312 of the July 5, 1919 Motion Picture News.

media.title: Auction of Souls (1919) - Ad 11.jpg
media.caption: Ad for the American film Auction of Souls (1919), in the color inserts before page 13 of the June 1, 1919 Film Daily. The ad refers to early showings of the film in New York and other cities, where a $10 admission was charged to raise funds for Armenian relief. When the film was issued for general release later that year, many theater ads compared their admission price with the $10 paid for the early showings of the film.

media.title: Auction of Souls (1919) - Ad 3.jpg
media.caption: Ad for the American film Auction of Souls (1919) at the Washington Theater in Detroit, Michigan, on page 313 of the July 5, 1919 Motion Picture News.

media.title: Auction of Souls (1919) - Ad 10.jpg
media.caption: Teaser ad for the American film Auction of Souls (1919) with Aurora Mardiganian, Anna Q. Nilsson, and several unidentified actresses, which does not mention the name of the film, on the front page of the April 20, 1919 Film Daily. The ad refers to early showings of the film in New York and other large cities, where a $10 admission was charged to raise funds for Armenian relief.
